_header: Burgess thou has so blown at the coal
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 285.

BLHar7578.First Lines:
Burgeys thou haste so blowen atte the coleThat alle thy rode is
                    from thine face agoon…
BLHar7578.Last Lines:
Ne the forto dispenden largelyffor spare mote thy poore bagge
                    fonde
BLHar7578.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “A Warning Against Lechery.” 
             Philological Quarterly
         35 (1956): 90-5: 93-5.
Bowers,  Robert Hood. 
             “A Middle English ‘Rake’s Progress’ Poem.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         70 (1955): 396-8: 397-8.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 260 (st. 1-3 only).
